Sentencas: A numerical model was implemented to analyze the thermodynamic performance of the co- and counter-flow operations of an anode-supported direct internal reforming (DIR) planar solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC).
Titulo: Selection of suitable operating conditions for planar anode-supported direct-internal-reforming solid-oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: This developed model was validated by comparing with experimental and simulated results taken from the literature.
Titulo: Selection of suitable operating conditions for planar anode-supported direct-internal-reforming solid-oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: The model is capable of capturing the detailed distribution of the local temperatures, species concentrations, current density, and polarization losses in streamwise direction.
Titulo: Selection of suitable operating conditions for planar anode-supported direct-internal-reforming solid-oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: Energy and exergy concepts were used to evaluate the DIR-SOFC performance under co- and counter-flow operations.
Titulo: Selection of suitable operating conditions for planar anode-supported direct-internal-reforming solid-oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: The study indicates the energy and exergy efficiencies of DIR-SOFC performance under co-flow operation are more sensitive to the increase of current density than that under counter-flow operation.
Titulo: Selection of suitable operating conditions for planar anode-supported direct-internal-reforming solid-oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: Particular attention was paid to cell temperature profiles to avoid mechanical failure due to high thermal stresses.
Titulo: Selection of suitable operating conditions for planar anode-supported direct-internal-reforming solid-oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: The result shows that the material constraints need to be considered as well as the energy and rational efficiencies in evaluating the performance of SOFC.
Titulo: Selection of suitable operating conditions for planar anode-supported direct-internal-reforming solid-oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: The preferred flow configuration can be changed depending on the cell geometry and operation conditions if we consider the material constraints.
Titulo: Selection of suitable operating conditions for planar anode-supported direct-internal-reforming solid-oxide fuel cell
